Generally, when creating a sentinel error value, the errors.New function from the errors package is used instead of the fmt.Errorf function youâ€™ve been using thus far.

Using errors.New instead of fmt.Errorf does not make any foundational changes to how the error works, though, and both functions could be used interchangeably most of the time.

Since sentinel errors are fundamental errors with values that donâ€™t change, itâ€™s common to use errors.New to create them.
